com.mygdx.game.player

Class Character

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureRegion
      • com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.Sprite
        • com.mygdx.game.player.Character
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Enemy, Player

    public class Character
extends com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.Sprite
    This class represents a sprite in the game with animations and movement
    Version:
    May 31, 2015
    Author:
    Christopher Cheung, Other contributors: Andrew Si, Nathan Lui, Period: 4, Assignment: my-gdx-game-core, Sources: libgdx

    • Constructor Detail

      • Character

        public Character(com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Array<com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureAtlas.AtlasRegion> frames)
        The Character constructor for Enemy, which uses the same Array to create the same Animation for each direction.
        Parameters:
        frames - the animation frame used for every direction

      • Character

        public Character(com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Array<com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureAtlas.AtlasRegion> up,
         com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Array<com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureAtlas.AtlasRegion> right,
         com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Array<com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureAtlas.AtlasRegion> down,
         com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Array<com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureAtlas.AtlasRegion> left)
        The Character constructor for Player, which takes four Array and uses them to initialize the animations for each direction. Also initializes font to display information about the Character on-screen. Initial frame to be drawn for Character is set.
        Parameters:
        up - north-ward animation frames
        right - east-ward animation frames
        down - south-ward animation frames
        left - west-ward animation frames

      • Character

        public Character()
        Constructor for testing. Initializes Character with position (0, 0), moveSpeed 10, and level 1.

    • Method Detail

      • drawBars

        public void drawBars(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.Batch batch,
            com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.glutils.ShapeRenderer renderer)
        Draws the stats of the Character around the sprite. Each bar must have a height of BARHEIGHT and appear below the Character with hp bar ontop of the exp bar hp bar and exp bar must only be drawn when hp and exp is less than their maximum (maxHp and expToLevel respectively) Uses the BitmapFont to write the level of the Character above the sprite and to write the hp values next to the hp bar
        Parameters:
        batch - Batch to draw the words with
        renderer - the ShapeRenderer used to draw rectangles representing the bars

      • move

        public void move(Character character,
        java.util.ArrayList<Projectile> projectiles,
        long time)
        This method should be overridden for better functionality moves sprite according to its current direction This method should also be called by overridden method to update animations
        Parameters:
        character - for sub classes to interact with environment
        projectiles - list of all projectiles, given to add this Character's projectiles to environment (for shooting functions)
        time - Time in game (used in order to determine delays in moving or shooting)

      • move

        public void move()
        Moves sprite according to its current direction. Then translates Character in the appropriate direction by one unit using the translate(int, int) method.

      • translate

        public void translate(int dx,
             int dy)
        uses translateX and translateY to move Character by dx and dy multiplied by moveSpeed units respectively. If Character moves along a diagonal (neither dx nor dy are equal to 0), divide the value inside both translateX and translateY by Math.sqrt(2).
        Parameters:
        dx - change in x-coordinate
        dy - change in y-coordinate

      • shoot

        public void shoot(java.util.ArrayList<Projectile> projectiles,
         float xDistance,
         float yDistance,
         long time,
         java.lang.String spriteType)
        Puts a projectile that this Character shoots into the given Projectile array
        Parameters:
        projectiles - ArrayList of Projectiles to add this Character's projectile to
        xDistance - the x distance for the slope that the projectile should take
        yDistance - the y distance for the slope that the projectile should take
        time - Current time in milliseconds to determine if this Character can shoot
        spriteType - String representing this what type of sprite this Character is

      • increaseCurrentLevel

        public void increaseCurrentLevel()
        Increases the level of the character and uses MimicGdx to play the sound file for leveling up. Increase baseDmg by 2 and maxHp by 10. Increase the currentHp to maintain the same ratio of currentHp to maxHp prior to increasing maxHp.

      • setDirection

        public void setDirection(int dir)
        Setter method for setDirection. Input will be modded by 8 so that direction will be a valid integer in the range [0, 8)
        Parameters:
        dir -

      • increaseMaxHp

        public void increaseMaxHp(int i)
        increases maxHp by the input value
        Parameters:
        i - integer to increase maxHp by

      • increaseCurrentHp

        public void increaseCurrentHp(int i)
        increases currentHp by the input value. If currentHp exceeds maxHp, currentHp is reduced to equal maxHp.
        Parameters:
        i - integer to increase currentHp by

      • isDead

        public boolean isDead()
        returns whether character is dead
        Returns:
        true if currentHp <= 0. False otherwise.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a String that represents this Character
        See Also:
        Returns a String that represents this Character: HP: currentHp / maxHp; Base Damage, RandomMod, Direction, reloadSpeed, previousTime, moveSpeed
